required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: INO 5401 Vaccination in BRCA1/2 Mutation Carriers
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1b Study of INO-5401 Alone or INO-5401 in Combination With INO-9012 Followed by Electroporation in Adults With BRCA1 or BRCA2 Mutations

lead_sponsor.agency: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

clinical_study.source: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania

brief_summary.textblock: The research study is being conducted to test an experimental vaccine to potentially prevent cancer for people with BRCA1 or BRCA2 mutations. This study will test if the vaccine is safe (without significant side effects) and test a new way of administering vaccines. It will also test whether the vaccine activates your immune system.

primary_outcome.time_frame: for 2 years after last dose of study treatment
primary_outcome.description: Dose-limiting toxicities will be classified by system organ class (SOC), preferred term (PT), severity, and relationship to Study Treatment, and graded in accordance with Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 5.0.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: for 2 years after last dose of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as >2-fold increase in spot-forming units (SFU) relative to baseline at any mid-treatment or post-treatment time point, in any antigen-specific T cell as measured by ELISPOT

arm_group.description: Participants receive INO-5401 9mg DNA vaccine on Day 1 of Weeks 4, 8, and 12
Participants receive INO-5401 9mg DNA and INO-09012 1 mg DNA vaccine on Day 1 of Weeks 4, 8, and 12

overall_official.affiliation: Abramson Cancer Center of the University of Pennsylvania
